answers.answer: Welcome to our cyber family.Are you seeing a neurologist,one preferabaly one that is a ms specialist.Your current DR should have followed up with additional testing such as a c-spine mri,thoracic mri, a lumbar puncture.He should of ran test to exclude other disorders.Yes,your symptoms are suggestive of MS,but many disorders do mimic ms.Internet research can be good if you have a diagnosis,but so much of it can show to be false information.Get yourself a new DR and take the past MRI with you,make a time line and ask lots of questions.T

T-Lynn is correct,See a Neurologist who has a large MS practice.  Contact your local chapter of the National MS Society to get some names.  Here is the link:http://www.nationalmssociety.org/site/PageServer?pagename=HOM_FIND_homepage

Thanks for the welcome and for the response!  I am so frustrated at the moment!  My current doctor just told me he thought it was something autoimmune but had no clue as to what and then he told me that he just doesn't know everything... Like I didnt already know that! ...  He sent me to a local neuro that said I had Essential Tremors but wasn't interested in looking at the MRI or hearing about my other symptoms.  AHHHHHHHHHHHH! I am currently trying to get in to see a MS specialist at Vanderbilt.  It's the closest place to where I live.  The only test I have had done was the MRI and test to eliminate Lupus, Lyme Disease, and diabetes.  Since my tremors are the most visible its what everyone focuses on. I want to give up but I know that something is causing all of this and it might not be MS, and that would be great but I would still like to know what is going on!

Its okay to be frustrated.Your Dr and neuro need to be rpasted at our cyber bonfire weenie(bad drs) roast.You know your body and that neuro needs wapped with his medical book upside his head.Try to get into a good neuro it may take time,but let them know that you have had an abnormal mri,it might speed the process up.Hang in here,we are here for ya.T

question: I have been have a lot of vague symptoms for the past 15 years or so.  I am a 47 year old female. In the last 4 years I have had 2 episodes of ARDS with pneumonia, tremors in the hands, head, legs that are increasing.  I had an MRI last year that said there were several minimal focal signal abnormalties with the white matter with a suggestion of MS.  I have several other symptoms such as a midsection spasm that takes away my breath, trouble with balance, falling, dizziness, forgetfulness, problems concentrating, heat sensitivity, numbness in the right leg that sharp tearing pains, and the list goes on and on..Some of the symptoms come and go but the tremors, muscle aches and pains, balance and coordination and concentration problems are pretty much with me all the time.  I am currently trying to figure out if I am just nuts or if I am just not seeing the right doctor!  Is there any one out there that could make a suggestion as to what my next move would be as far as seeking help. Or if any of the symptoms that I have could even suggest MS or maybe something else.  I have tried to do research on my own on the internet but with so much information out there its hard to know if what I am reading is correct or not.  Any help is apprecitated!
title: I havent a clue what is going on!
